revised_title: The Germicidal Action of Radium Emanations on Micro-Organisms
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the effects of radium emanations on micro-organisms. They found that radium had a germicidal action, killing specific and extraneous micro-organisms in vaccine samples and other bacteria after exposure to the radium at a distance of 1-2 mm for varying lengths of time. This research provided new insights into the regulation of animal heat and the potential use of radium in sterilization processes.
